learning_outcomes.description: Translate knowledge breast anatomy and physiology into clinical practice. Identify breast structures and common pathologies on breast imaging.
Examine the indications for Breast MRI and apply the correct imaging protocol.
Identify the requirements and procedures to perform Breast MRI, including communication skills, scheduling, forms, preparation, and positioning.
Appraise MRI sequences used to diagnose breast disease. Examine the post processing tools utilised in evaluating breast MRI images.
Illustrate the role of MRI in the imaging chain utilised to diagnose breast disease.
Assess Breast MRI findings and their clinical significance.

assessments.due_date: Submission required prior to tutorial Week 2 - Week 13
assessments.task_description: Participate in Tutorial Padlet Activities as required throughout the semester. Activity involves short response to task set on Padlet. There are 10 activities throughout the semester, each weighted 2%.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Research and write an essay of 2000 words (+/-10%) on topics posted on Blackboard. Wordcount does not include footnotes and bibliography. This assessment requires independent research. Students must source texts independently so as to demonstrate original research.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments for this course will be submitted electronically via Blackboard and using TurnItIn.  (learn.uq.edu.au).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Topics are posted on Blackboard. A critical evaluation of the literature relating to the selected. This assessment task is designed to improve the student's writing and critical thinking skills. Select a topic, formulate a research question and perform a literature review.


Research and write a literature review of 2500 words (+/-10%). Wordcount does not include footnotes and bibliography. This assessment requires independent research. Students must source texts independently so as to demonstrate original research.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments for this course will be submitted electronically via Blackboard and using TurnItIn.  (learn.uq.edu.au).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Type: Exam – during Exam Period (Central)

Reading time: 10 minutes

Duration: 90 minutes 

Description: The examination is a non-invigilated online exam. It will be centrally timetabled. You will have 10 minutes planning time followed by 90 minutes to complete the exam. A further 15 minutes are allowed during which you must upload your exam to Blackboard. You will be advised of the date and time in which to complete the examination once the examination timetable has been determined. Note that late penalties will be strictly applied as per university policy.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
